description.full: Exceptionally pure silica sand harvested from specific locations on Murano island. Its unique composition makes it essential for Venice's legendary glass production.
description.flavor: Beneath your feet lies the foundation of Venice's crystalline reputationâ€”mere grains to some, but to the glass masters, these sands are more precious than gold.

historicalNotes.historicalSignificance: The unique composition of Murano sand, with its exceptional purity and specific mineral content, was a closely guarded secret of Venetian glassmaking. This special sand, when combined with soda ash, produced glass of unparalleled clarity and workability, enabling Venetian glassmakers to create their world-renowned cristallo glass. The Republic strictly controlled access to these sand deposits, considering them a strategic resource.
